titleStmt.title: A form of prayer and thanksgiving to Almighty God for having made his Highness the Prince of Orange the glorious instrument of the great deliverance of this kingdom from popery and arbitary power. To be used in the city of London and ten miles distant thereof, on the 31 of January instant, and throughout the whole kingdom on the 14 of February next.
titleStmt.author: Church of England.

titleStmt.title: A form of prayer and thanksgiving to Almighty God for having made his Highness the Prince of Orange the glorious instrument of the great deliverance of this kingdom from popery and arbitary power. To be used in the city of London and ten miles distant thereof, on the 31 of January instant, and throughout the whole kingdom on the 14 of February next.
titleStmt.author: Church of England.

notesStmt.note: Text of prayers in black letter.
Order to print dated: Die Martis, January 22 1688/9. Signed: Jo. Brown cleric. Parliamentorum.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
